physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Provisional diagnosis of osteopetrosis ruled out by morphological, phenotypic, and radiographic characteristics.
Particularly difficult surgery noted; osseous surfaces devoid of cancellous bone; sclerotic and brittle cortex; small defective acetabulum.
Chronic osteomyelitis of the right tibia; sequestrectomy performed.
Patient denied symptoms in the hips; walked with the help of two canes; residual varus deformities in both femora.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Bilateral periprosthetic fractures healed with varus deformities; wear noted on both acetabular components.
